sentence.Network_en: Such an idea was scarcely thinkable ten years ago.
sentence.Network_cn: 十年前，这样的想法几乎是难以想象的。

sentence.Network_en: I'm sorry to say her idea is hardly thinkable.
sentence.Network_cn: 对不起,她的想法是几乎不可想像的.

sentence.Network_en: War between big powers would once again become thinkable.
sentence.Network_cn: 大国之间的战争将重新成为可能.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 3.001 thinkable(可思考的)都是imagined(可被想象或可图像化),这里维氏只是论证了3 的一个方向。 3.01 结合3 与2.21 推出“真思想的总和是世界的图像”。.
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译... ... think-so 未经证实的想法 thinkable 可相信的 thinker 思想者.
think的用法_百度知道 ... think through: 想透，充分考虑（事情的后果） thinkable: 可想象的 thinker: 思想家，思考者.
新浪新浪网 - Dictionary ... think-so 未经证实的想法 thinkable 能想到的,可相信的 thinker 思想家;思考者.

list.abs: Such an idea was scarcely thinkable ten years ago ., 十年前 , 这样的想法几乎是难以想像的.
What thinkable is also possible ., 所有能被想象的也是可能的.
this already was her exclusive thinkable reason ., 这已是她唯一能想到的理由了.
He said that her idea is hardly thinkable ., 他说她的观念几乎是无法想像的.

means.word_mean: 1. capable of being conceived or imagined or considered

auth_sentence.content: Just months ago, such a program would have been un-thinkable.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: That's just not thinkable, in any way, shape, or form.

auth_sentence.content: It is thinkable that the mind, and the brain are reflexive in the style, the mind-the brain-the mind.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is thinkable that the mind, and the brain are reflexive in the style, the mind-the brain-the mind.
